result.execSummary:
The defendant Trent J Chones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: to time now serving

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Comply with rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Must be compliant with any and all child support obligations or paternity actions.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to time now serving.

Defendant Trent J Chones in court with attorney Bruce A Fishbain.  Defendant Trent J Chones in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Trent J Chones in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Trent J Chones in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Defense requests an adjournment. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Trent J Chones in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Trent J Chones in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
